description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

Google Play is growing at a rapid pace, serving more than a billion Android users, both new and existing, with apps and games that are innovative, useful, entertaining and locally relevant. You'll be part of the Google Play Apps and Games business development team, helping strategic partners gain business success through business development initiatives and projects. You will be at the center of a cross-functional team of people across multiple sites, including Business Development, Product Management, Engineering, UX, Merchandising, Marketing, Operations, and Support.

Google Play offers music, movies, books, apps and games for your devices, powered by the cloud. It’s a Google approach to entertainment, syncing magically across your devices and on the web. As part of the Android and Mobile team, Googlers working on Google Play do everything from engineering our backend systems, to shaping the product strategy, to forming great content partnerships. They make it possible for people to do things like buy an ebook or song on their Android phone, then have it instantly available on their laptop. The Google Play team helps strengthen the overall Android ecosystem by giving developers and partners a premium store where they can reach millions of users.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in a technical/business field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of business strategy and analytics experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience using mobile data and metrics to anticipate user needs and create actionable strategies and recommendations to grow the business.
  • Understanding of data analytics (SQL, etc), and the apps ecosystem, business models, distribution channels, competitive landscape, and developer success metrics.
  • Strategic thinker with a track record of developing and executing business strategy, leading to business growth.
  • Ability to multitask and operate with cross-functional teams in a fast paced, ambiguous and rapidly changing environment.
  • Effective attention to detail and ability to set priorities, drive decisions, create structured processes and respond proactively to potential issues.
responsibilities:
• Manage the ramp-up and growth of a new business opportunity for Google Play, working closely with cross-functional teams including Business Development, Engineering, Product Management, Merchandising and Marketing.
  • Analyze data and trends to drive new insights, create strategies for the program and product, and make recommendations that drive the business forward.
  • Collaborate with other teams in Play to manage all aspects of developer onboarding, implementation, verification, and launch.
  • Define and monitor business metrics across multiple markets, lead operational reviews and strategy planning sessions and make catalog and product recommendations.
title: Strategy and Business Manager, New Business Models, Google Play
